org.adroitlogic.ultraesb.api.mediation

Interface ClusterSupport


  • public interface ClusterSupport
    The cluster and group co-ordination related functionality.
    Since:
    2.1.0

    • Method Detail

      • isClustered

        boolean isClustered()
        Checks whether the clustering is enabled or not
        Returns:
        true if clustering is enabled, false otherwise

      • isAlive

        boolean isAlive()
        Checks whether the node is connected to the cluster or not. This method may return false in-case of a failure to establish a session with the ZooKeeper, or in-case of a network failure which result in the ZooKeeper connection to be dropped, or if the ZooKeeper quorum is down resulting the connections by ZooKeeper clients (like ClusterManager) to terminate there connections
        Returns:
        whether the cluster is connected or not

      • getDomain

        java.lang.String getDomain()
        Gives the cluster domain of the cluster, if clustering is enabled
        Returns:
        the cluster domain

      • getNodeName

        java.lang.String getNodeName()
        Gives the node name of this node in the cluster domain
        Returns:
        the name of this node in the cluster domain

      • getQualifiedSessionId

        java.lang.String getQualifiedSessionId()
        Gives the current session of this node in the cluster domain in the form of, $DOMAIN:$NODE_NAME:$SESSION_ID where the
        • $DOMAIN is ClusterSupport.getDomain()
        • $NODE_NAME is ClusterSupport.getNodeName()
        • $SESSION_ID is the current local session id of this node in the cluster
        Returns:
        the current session identifier of the node in the cluster

      • getActiveNodeNames

        java.util.List getActiveNodeNames()

        Returns:
        the list of active node names

      • getActiveNodeCount

        Returns:
        the number of active nodes in the domain

      • getCurrentlyActingAsNodes

        Returns:
        the currently acting as node name list

      • getFailoverNodeNames

        java.util.List getFailoverNodeNames()
        Gives the list of node names to which this node provides failover facility
        Returns:
        the list of nodes that this node acts as a failover hop

      • isActingAs

        boolean isActingAs(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Is this node acting as the given node
        Parameters:
        nodeName - the node name to check the acting as
        Returns:
        true of the given node name is being acted by this node

      • canFailover

        boolean canFailover(java.lang.String nodeName)
        Can this node act as the failover node for the given node name
        Parameters:
        nodeName - the node name to test for failover
        Returns:
        true if this node is a failover hop for the given node name

      • tryLock

        boolean tryLock(java.lang.String path)
        This methods never blocks or wait to acquire the lock. Try to lock the given path, if successful boolean true will be returned, if not acquired false will be returned.

        This method doesn't guarantee to acquire the lock, if the lock can be acquired it does so but do not wait and try to acquire it again and again. Should be useful in cases where you need a distributed access to a single location. The path can be a hierarchical path where the '/' being the path delimiter. However locks are not hierarchical meaning that getting a lock at path messages/db doesn't block another user from taking a lock at path messages/db/foo.

        Any successful lock acquired by this method should be released as sooner as possible to let any other node take the lock. However any lock miss (that is a false return from this method will clear the lock nodes created to try to acquire the lock within its protocol). Hence the usage pattern of this method should happen within a try-finally block as shown below

        String path = "messages/db/foo"; boolean lockAcquired; try { lockAcquired = mediation.getClusterSupport().tryLock(path); if (lockAcquired) { // do the processing with the lock } } catch(Exception e) { // exception handling } finally { if (lockAcquired) { mediation.getClusterSupport().releaseLock(path); } }
        Parameters:
        path - the global path representing the lock
        Returns:
        true if the lock is acquired, false if it is already acquired by somebody else or in case of an error

      • releaseLock

        void releaseLock(java.lang.String path)
        Release any distributed locks for the given path, and tries to deletes the path itself. However this method doesn't guarantee to delete the path. Should be used with tryLockPath method to make sure the lock cleanup works to some extent.
        Parameters:
        path - the path for which the lock to be released

      • publishCommand

        java.lang.String publishCommand(ControlCommand command)
        Publishes a ControlCommand into the complete cluster. Note that the publishing node will also execute this command via the command execution framework.
        Parameters:
        command - the command to be executed by the cluster
        Returns:
        the path at which the command is being published at

      • watchActiveNodes

        void watchActiveNodes(NodeWatcher watcher)
        Watches the active nodes space and notify the provided node watcher in-case of a node leaving the cluster or new node joining the cluster. The watch process is continuous as in once you register the NodeWatcher, then that watcher will be notified for all active node list changes until the user calls, ClusterSupport.unwatchActiveNodes(org.adroitlogic.ultraesb.api.mediation.helper.NodeWatcher). You may call this method more than once with different NodeWatcher references.
        Parameters:
        watcher - the watcher to be notified.

      • unwatchActiveNodes

        void unwatchActiveNodes(NodeWatcher watcher)
        Un-register the previously registered node watcher, it is unregistered at the functional level, where your NodeWatcher will not get any further notifications from this point onwards.
        Parameters:
        watcher - the watcher to be un-registered

      • nextSequenceNumber

        int nextSequenceNumber(java.lang.String path)
        Gets a distributed continuously increasing sequence number for the given path. For a specific path it is guaranteed to give a continuously increasing number which is bound by Integer.MAX_VALUE
        Parameters:
        path - the path to which the sequence number is generated
        Returns:
        the generated sequence number for the given path
